title: How to Set Up a Free CRM to Track Leads and Customers
description: Stop losing leads in text threads and sticky notes. Get organized with a free CRM.
requirements: A list of your current leads and customers (even if it's just in your head)

steps.title: Choose a free CRM
steps.description: Pick one based on your comfort level with technology.
substeps: For simplicity: HubSpot CRM (hubspot.com/crm) — free forever, easy to use
For trades: Jobber (jobber.com) — 14-day free trial, built for contractors
For spreadsheet lovers: Notion or Airtable — free, very flexible
steps.tip: HubSpot is genuinely free forever with no catch. Start there if you're not sure.

steps.title: Create your account
steps.description: Sign up and do the basic setup.
substeps: Go to your chosen CRM website
Enter your email and business name
Skip any sales calls — you don't need them to start

steps.title: Add your first 5 contacts
steps.description: Don't try to import everyone at once. Start small.
substeps: Think of 5 recent leads or customers
Add a note about what they needed
steps.tip: Include your most recent quote that hasn't closed yet. You'll follow up on it later.

steps.title: Set up simple deal stages
steps.description: Track where each lead is in your process.
substeps: Look for 'Deals' or 'Pipeline' in the menu
Create stages like: New Lead → Quote Sent → Won → Lost
Drag your contacts into the right stage
This is your visual sales tracker

steps.title: Make it part of your routine
steps.description: A CRM only works if you use it daily.
substeps: When a new lead calls: add them immediately
After sending a quote: update the stage
Set a reminder to check your CRM each morning
Review 'Quote Sent' deals weekly — follow up on stale ones

successMessage: You now have a system to track every lead! No more wondering 'did I follow up with that guy?'
proTips: The mobile app is key — add leads right after phone calls while the info is fresh
Don't over-complicate it. Name + phone + what they need is enough to start
Set up email templates for common messages like quote follow-ups
